stx.reactive.SignalBool

type
class

Static Methods

and(signals : Iterable<Signal<Bool>>) : Signal<Bool>

parameters
streams An Iterable of the Signals to be evaluated.
returns
If all the Signals in Iterable at a given time are true, true, else false.
Returns a Signal, true or false depending on whether or not all of the Signals supplied in the Iterable at a given point of time are true.

ifTrue<T>(condition : Signal<Bool>, thenS : Signal<T>, elseS : Signal<T>) : Signal<T>

parameters
contition A Signal of Bools that will be used to determine which Signal to return.
thenE The Signal that will be returned if stream == true;
elseE The Signal that will be returned if stream == false;
returns
If a Signal from condition == true Signal thenE, else Signal elseE
Switches off of a Signal of Bools, returning either a thenE Signal when true or an elseE when falseSignal.

not(signal : Signal<Bool>) : Signal<Bool>

Returns a Signal with the Bool of each value mapped to the opposite of the original original Signal.

or(signals : Iterable<Signal<Bool>>) : Signal<Bool>

parameters
streams An Iterable of the Signals to be evaluated.
returns
If any the Signals in Iterable at a given time are true, true, else false.
Returns a Signal, true or false depending on whether or not any of the Signals supplied in the Iterable at a given point of time are true.

new()
